text: Bottle. Pours clear magenta, small white-pink fizzy head, decent lacing. Aroma is cranberries, cherry, apple, mineral water. Flavor is light tart, light residual sweetness, hints of funk, cranberry again, tart cherry, green apple. Medium body. Interesting.
Pours a dark ruby red with a lasting thin head. Aroma is apple and cherry. Flavor is slightly tart apple and cherry, with a sweet finish. Well-carbonated and crisp. Dangerously good cider.

Aromas are apple and cherry. 

Color is a lovely ruby red with a small off-white head.

Taste is semi-sweet.

Finish is fairly long; it starts with the semi-sweet cherry/apple and ends with the apple aroma.

Overall I like the apple/cherry blend, though it may be just a bit too sweet and is fairly simple.
Bottle. Strong cherry and apple juice aroma. Chestnut brown. Lightly sweet cherry and apple juice flavor. Nice body. Great.

Bottle:
Dark, amber-red with a thin, pinkish head.
Cherry, apple scent.
Taste is almost tart.....crushed cherries, red apple,,,not even a hint of alcohol.
Tastes perfectly natural, like they just juiced it up in front of right in the field....
Good Stuff.

Sample at Crafted & Cured. Clear ruby-amber color with a medium thin off-white head that evaporates quickly to an outer ring. Spotty lacing. The aroma consists of apples, cherries and spice. Medium body with flavors of green apple, tart cherry and spice. The finish is semi-dry and fruity with cherry aftertaste. Decent overall.

Draft. Poured clear dark reddish amber color with a small off-white head that diminished slowly with good legs. Moderate aroma of sweet apple and cherry. Medium body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium apple and cherry flavor with a medium berry sweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations were exceeded.

Draft to taster at Dutchs. Pours a clear reddish amber color with a thin off white/pinkish ring. The aroma and flavor have sweet and tart apples and cherries, mild funk, some skins, better than your average cider.

Draft to taster at Dutchs. Looks good; a transparent cherry orange with off-white head that dissipates into lacing fairly quickly. Smells semi-sweet and semi-tart with a nice balance of apples and cherries. Tastes like it smells with a medium-bodied mouthfeel. Enjoyable.
Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer amber pour with an off white head. Aromas of cherry and apple. Taste is tart juicy berry with a nice dry finish.

12 oz. bottle split by Willrunforbeer. Interesting purple / violet in color without head. Aroma is sour apples with notes of cherry pie filling. 
Flavor is tart cherry pie filling with hints of liquid apples. Mild tartness with a balanced Apple. Pretty nice!

Bottle from umich03jm. Thanks, Jason! Pours garnet with a grayish off white head. Aroma is deep dark cherry and sharp apple. The dark cherry just overpowers the tart apple in the mouth. Just the right amount of carb.
bottle. Deep reddish with small head. Not surprisingly, theres a lot of cherry to be had with this one. Fairly complex flavors with undertones of vanilla and oak. Reasonably tart. Very solid.
Tap...beautiful garnet red pour. Outstanding balance of sweet apples and tart cherries. Finishes clean, crisp, and dry. One of the best ciders Ive ever had.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Bottle. Aroma is mostly apple cider but theres enough cherry syrup to notice it. Tastes perfectly balanced between apple cider and cherries. Light sweetness at first but a very tart and crisp finish. Delicious.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2015 Nice dark red pour with lots of bubbles to settle. A light cherry aroma. A smooth sweet and sour cherry flavor. Tart finish. Very drinkable. Good stuff. My first from the cider attempt and it wonât be my last.
On tap at the brewpub. Beautiful red pour with a nice fruity aroma. Delicious blend of apple and cherries in the taste. An excellent cider.
